subject: Are words starting with unstressed _be-_, _de-_ and _re-_ usually in HAPPY set?
msgSnippet: I just realised that I m a little confused about the happY set. Are the vowels in words that start with an unstressed _be-_, _de-_ and _re-_ syllable usually
messageBody:
I just realised that I'm a little confused about the happY set.

Are the vowels in words that start with an unstressed _be-_, _de-_ and
_re-_ syllable usually in the KIT set or are they in the HAPPY set?

Till now I've thought that they were KIT set words. The reason this
matters for me is because in my international QS project KIT set
vowels are represented with [It] and happY with [Eat].

eg: _before_ in RP (according to Longman's) -> /bIfO:, b@fO:/
_beside_ -> /bIsaId, b@saId/
_depending_ -> /dIpendIN, d@pendIN/
_despite_ -> /dIspaIt, d@spaIt/
_regarding_ -> /rIgA:dIN, r@gA:dIN/

Thanks
